list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment:
!!! memory leak fix !!!
1. Saving and execution of glfw callback fixed to remove memory leak. Now callback function is set not to other GC in two steps. 1) User can set deleter. All callback is stored under weakly referenced deleter, so when deleter if GCed whole collection of callbacks are removed automatically. 2) callback function itself is saved as a weakMethod. i.e in case method's instance is GCed method is removed also -> callback function will disappear. i.e in case instance's method is removed in any case -> callback function will disappear.

list.name: 1. Wrote custom frame for glfw Window. This is to extend function of window like mouse picking. As a result (class)Window and window drawing pipline has been fixed. Now things are not drawn directly on glfw default framebuffer(which is unaccessible), rather drawing on custom myframe and copied onto the window right before frame swap using glBlit.
1.reorganized relationship between Window - GLFW.context - FBL - Renderer - Render_unit.

task.summary: Default task

changelist.name: 1. Wrote custom frame for glfw Window. This is to extend function of window like mouse picking. As a result (class)Window and window drawing pipline has been fixed. Now things are not drawn directly on glfw default framebuffer(which is unaccessible), rather drawing on custom myframe and copied onto the window right before frame swap using glBlit.
1.reorganized relationship between Window - GLFW.context - FBL - Renderer - Render_unit.

task.summary: included essential vendor packages into dir vend_src: numpy pyopengl glfw pillow

mouse update: manually setting mouse state -> as 'instant': when window resizing by dragging the edge of the window, mouse is manually set as left button pressed and mouse onscreen. this setting makes a list of instant mouse state which is handled per every frame by mouse.reset()
started thinking about gui buillder...
fixed buffer swap, render calculatioin automation
savepoint before implementing render on texture
wrote basic render on framebuffer recall rendering from texture to verity framebuffer writing

1. revised patter.UCD It works but not sure whether this is nescessary or comprehensive.
2. revised patter.SMI Think this is useful(temporal thought)
3. general code cleaning
...next Rendering image is initiated so
1.go back to GUI building and
2.implement mouse cursor collision.

2019/05/22 following commit 2d8d033ffae85ceea355474dae12633eb035df04
1. custom exception handler in Virtual_scope.compile() built
revising render_unit_builder pipeline
building renderer builder
building render_object pipeline_builder and revising render_object pipeline itself

building pipeline and pipline_builder and finally something is drawn on the window
and
building trackable openGL object which represents unique glfw context(shared windows have same GL_tracker object and it stores information abount generated gl objects and currently bound and much more as it gets developed)
can't figure out why nothing is drawn in first draw call

okay internet says intel graphics driver has a bug - so first draw problem is presumably a bug need to bind index buffer even if vertex array buffer is used. Implemented tester for checking if buffers(like elements) are shared in glfw context. In future some other checking could be implemented too. Render_unit is reconstructed. It's more stable. Per-renderer buffer-like-components is now called '(renderer)global component' and per-draw are '(render_unit's) unit component'. Render_unit thus contains components that stores per-draw info. Renderer and Render_unit is generated through 'render_builder', 'render_unit_builder' by referencing renderer_temp(late)' and render_unit_temp'. All opengl functions will be wrapped through 'Trackable_openGL'. This is to give minimum, needed automation (such as handling unshared vertex array object) and to log context - openGL states.
Wrote full doc for (module)glfw_gl_tracker

1. Wrote custom frame for glfw Window. This is to extend function of window like mouse picking. As a result (class)Window and window drawing pipline has been fixed. Now things are not drawn directly on glfw default framebuffer(which is unaccessible), rather drawing on custom myframe and copied onto the window right before frame swap using glBlit.
2. Basic mouse picking implementd(need cleaning, refactoring followingly). Window.myframe's 2'nd output is reserved as index_color output. User should provide u_id_color uniform to use picking function.
3. -following #2. Should fix glsl parser to implement (class)Window's assigned parameters from (class)Window's side not from user's side. So to make user don't think about assigned parameters such as MM,VM,PM,u_id_color,output id_color while writing glsl text. Can this be built logically? or will it be just confusing?

Now things are not drawn directly on glfw default framebuffer(which is unaccessible), rather drawing on custom myframe and copied onto the window right before frame swap using glBlit.

3. -following #2. Should fix glsl parser to implement (class)Window's assigned parameters from (class)Window's side not from user's side. So to make user don't think about assigned parameters such as MM,VM,PM,u_id_color,output id_color while writing glsl text. Can this be built logically? or will it be just confusing?

So to make user don't think about assigned parameters such as MM,VM,PM,u_id_color,output id_color while writing glsl text. Can this be built logically? or will it be just confusing?

1. Wrote custom frame for glfw Window. This is to extend function of window like mouse picking. As a result (class)Window and window drawing pipline has been fixed. Now things are not drawn directly on glfw default framebuffer(which is unaccessible), rather drawing on custom myframe and copied onto the window right before frame swap using glBlit.
2. Basic mouse picking implementd(need cleaning, refactoring followingly). Window.myframe's 2'nd output is reserved as index_color output. User should provide u_id_color uniform to use picking function.
3. -following #2. Should fix glsl parser to implement (class)Window's assigned parameters from (class)Window's side not from user's side. So to make user don't think about assigned parameters such as MM,VM,PM,u_id_color,output id_color while writing glsl text. Can this be built logically? or will it be just confusing?

1. window - context - fbl - viewport can be set as current and referenced. 2. window - context - fbl is now distinct concept. window has both context and fbl(fbo?). Main drwaing pipeline will usually look at context and fbl.
1. rebuilt openGL object wrapper class. Set of classes are Object, Objects(controller of objects), Target. Inside the system no pure openGL object is visible.
1. fixed frame rebuild function. 2. fixed camera projection matrix update process
1. built window creation in the midle of main loop. 2. vertex array sharing has to be fixed for after-initiation-windows. They do not have vertex arrays generated beforehand.
backing up before Window class inheritence structure build
\Window class inheritence structure build

giving up <processing> style main and implementing new style which is simple (class)Window inheritence.
Fixed here and there including framebuffer contex management: 1. automation of viewport cleaning restriction on ambient_buffer(GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0) only. 2. Window's myframe(buffer) now has the maximum size main monitor - drawing on it only occures partially - this is fixed because deletion-generation of fbo, texture, rbo is too expensive causing window stall. Will only get rebuilt if window gets bigger then monitor - which would happen when window is moved to secondary monitor and that monitor is bigger than the first main monitor.
backup before implementing shader_buffer
implemented. need assessment and cleanup
1. Expanding window functionality. 2. Testing window handling and user-syntax by writing sketchup_like ui bar. 3. need to write function controlling window display order
1. window display order seems to be inappropriate. 2. developed window pinning action and 3. developing window action sharing 4. other window controlling organized and implemented
mouse callbacks organized and mapping function built.

Fixed viewport operation by revising late clear(which is default clear tactic) run conditions. Clearing will occure: 1. right before something is rendered on window's frame_buffer(myframe) with __enter__. 2. right after window's drawing function is called and current viewport is viewport is set to clear. 3. right before vieports.close() is called and current viewport is set to clear. Still couldn't deside whether Viewport is Window subordinary or FBL subordinary. Think it should be Window sub and create another functionality for FBL which is very mush similar to Viewport. This must be something like - Instant_viewport.
fixing memory leak. backup

!!! memory leak fix !!!
Revised window deletion operation. Stratagy is to simply implement delete() function in window sub classes. delete() basically remove glfw, gl contents objects is holding and removes Window object holding by resetting argument as None(ex. self._window = None).
Closing process goes through several steps by following several namespaces(?) >>> 1. Window().config_window_close() is called and some cleaning is done. 2. By erasing reference of Window object at Windows.__sub__() garbage collection for Window object will be called 3. and finally Window.__del__ is called by GC and rest of removal process continues.
Now I'm thinking step #3 can be merged into step #2 and have to test it with drawing functions.

1. Wrote custom frame for glfw Window. This is to extend function of window like mouse picking. As a result (class)Window and window drawing pipline has been fixed. Now things are not drawn directly on glfw default framebuffer(which is unaccessible), rather drawing on custom myframe and copied onto the window right before frame swap using glBlit.
2. Basic mouse picking implementd(need cleaning, refactoring followingly). Window.myframe's 2'nd output is reserved as index_color output. User should provide u_id_color uniform to use picking function.
3. -following #2. Should fix glsl parser to implement (class)Window's assigned parameters from (class)Window's side not from user's side. So to make user don't think about assigned parameters such as MM,VM,PM,u_id_color,output id_color while writing glsl text. Can this be built logically? or will it be just confusing?

\Window class inheritence structure build

giving up <processing> style main and implementing new style which is simple (class)Window inheritence.
Fixed here and there including framebuffer contex management: 1. automation of viewport cleaning restriction on ambient_buffer(GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0) only. 2. Window's myframe(buffer) now has the maximum size main monitor - drawing on it only occures partially - this is fixed because deletion-generation of fbo, texture, rbo is too expensive causing window stall. Will only get rebuilt if window gets bigger then monitor - which would happen when window is moved to secondary monitor and that monitor is bigger than the first main monitor.

1. Expanding window functionality. 2. Testing window handling and user-syntax by writing sketchup_like ui bar. 3. need to write function controlling window display order
1. window display order seems to be inappropriate. 2. developed window pinning action and 3. developing window action sharing 4. other window controlling organized and implemented
mouse callbacks organized and mapping function built.

Fixed viewport operation by revising late clear(which is default clear tactic) run conditions. Clearing will occure: 1. right before something is rendered on window's frame_buffer(myframe) with __enter__. 2. right after window's drawing function is called and current viewport is viewport is set to clear. 3. right before vieports.close() is called and current viewport is set to clear. Still couldn't deside whether Viewport is Window subordinary or FBL subordinary. Think it should be Window sub and create another functionality for FBL which is very mush similar to Viewport. This must be something like - Instant_viewport.
fixing memory leak. backup

!!! memory leak fix !!!
Revised window deletion operation. Stratagy is to simply implement delete() function in window sub classes. delete() basically remove glfw, gl contents objects is holding and removes Window object holding by resetting argument as None(ex. self._window = None).
Closing process goes through several steps by following several namespaces(?) >>> 1. Window().config_window_close() is called and some cleaning is done. 2. By erasing reference of Window object at Windows.__sub__() garbage collection for Window object will be called 3. and finally Window.__del__ is called by GC and rest of removal process continues.
Now I'm thinking step #3 can be merged into step #2 and have to test it with drawing functions.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
!!! memory leak fix !!!
Revised window deletion operation. Stratagy is to simply implement delete() function in window sub classes. delete() basically remove glfw, gl contents objects is holding and removes Window object holding by resetting argument as None(ex. self._window = None).
Closing process goes through several steps by following several namespaces(?) >>> 1. Window().config_window_close() is called and some cleaning is done. 2. By erasing reference of Window object at Windows.__sub__() garbage collection for Window object will be called 3. and finally Window.__del__ is called by GC and rest of removal process continues.
Now I'm thinking step #3 can be merged into step #2 and have to test it with drawing functions.
